required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects on Lipoprotein Metabolism From PCSK9 Inhibition Utilizing a Monoclonal Antibody
clinical_study.official_title: Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Single Site Study to Evaluate the Effects of Evolocumab (AMG 145) Treatment, Alone and in Combination With Atorvastatin, on Lipoprotein Kinetics

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial to evaluate the effect of evolocumab, atorvastatin, and combination therapy on lipoprotein kinetics.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Low-density Lipoprotein (LDL) Apolipoprotein B-100 Fractional Catabolic Rate (FCR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (5 days prior to Day 1) and Day 50; plasma samples for fasting lipids were obtained at 0, 5, 10, 20, 30, 40, and 60 min, as well as at 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, and 10 hours, and 2, 3, 4 and 5 days after D3-leucine administration.
primary_outcome.description: The fractional catabolic rate (the percentage of apolipoprotein B-100 in LDL which is replaced, transferred or lost per unit of time) was measured at Baseline and Day 50 over 5 consecutive days using the stable isotope tracer, D3-leucine. LDL particles were isolated from plasma by sequential ultracentrifugation, and isotopic enrichment was determined using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry. Mathematical modelling of the protein enrichment data was used to estimate protein catabolism.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in LDL-C at Day 50
Percent Change From Baseline in LDL Apolipoprotein B-100 Production Rate (PR)
secondary_outcome.description: The production rate of apolipoprotein B-100 in LDL was measured at Baseline and Day 50 over 5 consecutive days using the stable isotope tracer, D3-leucine. LDL particles were isolated from plasma by sequential ultracentrifugation and isotopic enrichment was determined using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry. Mathematical modelling of the protein enrichment data was used to estimate the production rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Lipoprotein (a) Fractional Catabolic Rate (FCR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (5 days prior to Day 1) and Day 50; plasma samples for fasting lipids were obtained at 0, 5, 10, 20, 30, 40, and 60 min, as well as at 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, and 10 hours, and 2, 3, 4 and 5 days after D3-leucine administration.
secondary_outcome.description: The fractional catabolic rate (the percentage of lipoprotein(a) (Lp[a]) which is replaced, transferred or lost per unit of time) was measured at Baseline and Day 50 over 5 consecutive days using the stable isotope tracer, D3-leucine. Lp(a) was isolated from plasma using an immunoprecipitation method employing immunomagnetic beads and polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Isotopic enrichment was determined using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry. Mathematical modelling of the protein enrichment data was used to estimate protein catabolism.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Lipoprotein(a) Production Rate (PR)
secondary_outcome.description: The production rate of lipoprotein(a) was measured at Baseline and Day 50 over 5 consecutive days using the stable isotope tracer, D3-leucine. Lp(a) was isolated from plasma using an immunoprecipitation method employing immunomagnetic beads and polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Isotopic enrichment was determined using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry. Mathematical modelling of the protein enrichment data was used to estimate protein catabolism.

arm_group.description: Participants received placebo subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks on days 1, 15, 29 and 43 and placebo tablets once a day for up to 8 weeks.
Participants received placebo subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks on days 1, 15, 29 and 43 and 80 mg atorvastatin orally once a day for up to 8 weeks.
Participants received 420 mg evolocumab by subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks on days 1, 15, 29 and 43 and placebo tablets once a day for up to 8 weeks.
Participants received 420 mg evolocumab by subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks on days 1, 15, 29 and 43 and 80 mg atorvastatin orally once a day for up to 8 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Fasting LDL-C at screening ≥ 100 mg/dL and ≤ 190 mg/dL
- Fasting triglycerides ≤ 150 mg/dL
- Body mass index (BMI) between 18.0 and 32.0 kg/m^2
- Framingham cardiac risk score 10% or less
Exclusion Criteria:
- Treatment with a lipid-regulating drug or over the counter supplement in the last 3 months prior to screening
- History of coronary heart disease (CHD) or CHD equivalent
- Uncontrolled hypertension
- Diabetes mellitus

reference.citation: Watts GF, Chan DC, Dent R, Somaratne R, Wasserman SM, Scott R, Burrows S, R Barrett PH. Factorial Effects of Evolocumab and Atorvastatin on Lipoprotein Metabolism. Circulation. 2017 Jan 24;135(4):338-351. doi: 10.1161/CIRCULATIONAHA.116.025080. Epub 2016 Dec 9.

Watts GF, Chan DC, Somaratne R, Wasserman SM, Scott R, Marcovina SM, Barrett PHR. Controlled study of the effect of proprotein convertase subtilisin-kexin type 9 inhibition with evolocumab on lipoprotein(a) particle kinetics. Eur Heart J. 2018 Mar 16. doi: 10.1093/eurheartj/ehy122. [Epub ahead of print]

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted at 2 centers in Australia. The first participant was enrolled on 08 July 2014, and the last participant enrolled on 15 December 2014.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants who met eligibility criteria underwent an initial 4 week run-in period of dietary stabilization before randomization. Randomization was stratified based on screening low-density lipoprotein (LDL-C) concentration (< 130 mg/dL vs ≥ 130 mg/dL)

group.description: Participants received placebo subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks on days 1, 15, 29 and 43 and placebo tablets once a day for up to 8 weeks.

group.description: Participants received 420 mg evolocumab by subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks on days 1, 15, 29 and 43 and placebo tablets once a day for up to 8 weeks.

group.description: Participants received 420 mg evolocumab by subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks on days 1, 15, 29 and 43 and 80 mg atorvastatin orally once a day for up to 8 weeks.

baseline.population: The full analysis set includes all randomized participants who received any study drug.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Low-density Lipoprotein (LDL) Apolipoprotein B-100 Fractional Catabolic Rate (FCR)
outcome.description: The fractional catabolic rate (the percentage of apolipoprotein B-100 in LDL which is replaced, transferred or lost per unit of time) was measured at Baseline and Day 50 over 5 consecutive days using the stable isotope tracer, D3-leucine. LDL particles were isolated from plasma by sequential ultracentrifugation, and isotopic enrichment was determined using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry. Mathematical modelling of the protein enrichment data was used to estimate protein catabolism.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (5 days prior to Day 1) and Day 50; plasma samples for fasting lipids were obtained at 0, 5, 10, 20, 30, 40, and 60 min, as well as at 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, and 10 hours, and 2, 3, 4 and 5 days after D3-leucine administration.
outcome.population: Efficacy Analysis Set including all randomized and dosed participants who completed baseline and Day 50 measurements.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received placebo subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks on days 1, 15, 29 and 43 and placebo tablets once a day for up to 8 weeks.

group.description: Participants received placebo subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks on days 1, 15, 29 and 43 and 80 mg atorvastatin orally once a day for up to 8 weeks.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Low-density Lipoprotein (LDL) Apolipoprotein B-100 Fractional Catabolic Rate (FCR)
measure.description: The fractional catabolic rate (the percentage of apolipoprotein B-100 in LDL which is replaced, transferred or lost per unit of time) was measured at Baseline and Day 50 over 5 consecutive days using the stable isotope tracer, D3-leucine. LDL particles were isolated from plasma by sequential ultracentrifugation, and isotopic enrichment was determined using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry. Mathematical modelling of the protein enrichment data was used to estimate protein catabolism.
measure.population: Efficacy Analysis Set including all randomized and dosed participants who completed baseline and Day 50 measurements.

analysis.groups_desc: The superiority of evolocumab monotherapy to placebo was tested using a 2-sided p-value at a significance level of 0.05.
analysis.method_desc: Model includes terms for the 2 factors in the factorial design (placebo or evolocumab and oral placebo or statin), their interaction, and LDL-C level.

analysis.groups_desc: The treatment effect of evolocumab plus atorvastatin compared with placebo plus atorvastatin was estimated and a nominal p-value is provided.
analysis.method_desc: Model includes terms for the 2 factors in the factorial design (placebo or evolocumab and oral placebo or statin), their interaction, and LDL-C level.

analysis.groups_desc: To assess whether the treatment effect of evolocumab compared with placebo depended on being administered alone or combined with atorvastatin, the interaction was tested, i.e., the difference between the treatment difference versus the respective placebo group for the evolocumab+atorvastatin group and the evolocumab group was calculated.
analysis.method_desc: Model includes terms for the 2 factors in the factorial design (placebo or evolocumab and oral placebo or statin), their interaction, and LDL-C level.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in LDL-C at Day 50
outcome.population: Efficacy Analysis Set with available data at both time points

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Lipoprotein (a) Fractional Catabolic Rate (FCR)
outcome.description: The fractional catabolic rate (the percentage of lipoprotein(a) (Lp[a]) which is replaced, transferred or lost per unit of time) was measured at Baseline and Day 50 over 5 consecutive days using the stable isotope tracer, D3-leucine. Lp(a) was isolated from plasma using an immunoprecipitation method employing immunomagnetic beads and polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Isotopic enrichment was determined using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry. Mathematical modelling of the protein enrichment data was used to estimate protein catabolism.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (5 days prior to Day 1) and Day 50; plasma samples for fasting lipids were obtained at 0, 5, 10, 20, 30, 40, and 60 min, as well as at 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, and 10 hours, and 2, 3, 4 and 5 days after D3-leucine administration.

reported_events.time_frame: From first dose of study drug until day 73
reported_events.desc: Other Adverse Events summarizes the non-serious occurrences of adverse events that exceed the indicated frequency threshold.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Clinical Trial Agreement generally does not restrict an investigator's discussion of trial results after completion. The Agreement permits Amgen a limited period of time to review material discussing trial results (typically up to 45 days and possible extension). Amgen may remove confidential information, but authors have final control and approval of publication content. For multicenter studies, the investigator agrees not to publish any results before the first multi-center publication.
